newsitem.title: USA: Cisco buys stake in closely held Software.com.
newsitem.headline: Cisco buys stake in closely held Software.com.

text.p: Cisco Systems Inc. said Monday it bought a minority stake, for an undisclosed sum, in closely held Software.com Inc., a software company that develops networking computer programmes.
Cisco, the world's biggest maker of computer networking equipment, will use Software.com's technology to make it easier for its customers to set up networks for managing email, the companies said.
Software.com, based in Santa Barbara, Calif., writes computer programmes that manage the flow of emails in networks that have thousands of users.
Cisco, based in San Jose, Calif., will sell Software.com's products with its line of routers and switches -- the devices that shuffle information between computer networks.
Terms of the transaction were not disclosed.

Cisco regularly buys small stakes in small companies that offer products it cannot develop on its own. Software.com will use the cash it received from Cisco "to grow as fast as we can," said Valdur Koha, Software.com's chief operating officer.
